isis.stitle: VT 365 Diesel Engine - 2004 Model Year - REAR COVER, FLYWHEEL, and POWER STEERING GEAR DRIVE - Installation - Secondary Flange

caution.para: To prevent possible damage to the engine, transmission, or truck, correct dowel pin protrusion is critical when aligning the flywheel or flexplate and the reinforcement ring.

step1.para: Install the dowel pin in the secondary flange gear.

figure.caption: Dowel pin in the secondary flange gear

step1.para: Use a dial caliper to verify the protrusion height. Dowel pin protrusion should be 8.0 ± 0.25 mm (0.315 ± 0.01 in).
Clean the inside surfaces and the inner face surface of the secondary flange gear.

caution.para: To prevent possible damage to the engine or truck, do not apply sealant on the face of the primary flange or the inner mounting surface of the secondary flange.

figure.caption: Application of Loctite® on the primary crankshaft flange

step1.para: Apply Loctite® on the outside diameter of the primary crankshaft flange.

figure.caption: Application of Loctite® on the primary crankshaft flange

step1.para: Spread the Loctite® evenly around primary crankshaft flange. Do not get any Loctite® on the face of the crankshaft flange.

caution.para: To prevent damage to the engine, transmission, or vehicle, seat the secondary flange onto crankshaft in one step. When two surfaces are mated (air is removed) Loctite® sets up within 5 minutes. Installation after Loctite® has set will break the seal between the crankshaft flange and the secondary flange and cause leakage.

step1.para: Install two Crankshaft Secondary Flange Installation Studs, evenly spaced, into the crankshaft flange.
Align the dowel pin hole with the crankshaft dowel pin and slide secondary flange onto the studs.

note.para: You have 5 minutes to fully draw the secondary flange onto the crankshaft flange.

step1.para: Install two nuts and washers. Seat the flange by alternately tightening nuts on the studs.
Remove nuts, washers, and studs after flange has been seated.

caution.para: To prevent possible engine or vehicle damage, do not drive the idler gear onto the shaft: this could damage the gear and gear teeth. For correct fit, rotate the gear for the power steering and fuel pump assembly .
To prevent possible engine or vehicle damage, ensure the circular witness groove is facing you. Installing the gear in backwards will cause abnormal wear and damage to the gear.

step1.para: Install power steering idler gear on shaft.

note.para: The gear of the power steering and fuel pump assembly may have to be rotated for correct fit of the gears. Do not drive the gear onto the shaft.

step1.para: Verify correct gear orientation and gear teeth engagement.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes.

figure.caption: Power steering idler gear retaining ring on shaft

step1.para: Install retaining ring onto the shaft for the power steering idler gear
Check the idler gear backlash. See .
Install new gasket on rear oil seal carrier.

figure.caption: Rear cover and rear oil seal carrier

step1.para: Install two M8 x 70 bolts in lower holes of rear oil seal carrier . Tighten bolts to the standard torque .
Install six remaining x 285 bolts M8 to secure rear oil seal carrier to rear cover.. Tighten bolts to the standard torque .
